title: Gomoku Game State JSON Schema
description: JSON schema for Gomoku game state, used for saving games and client-server communication with gomoku-httpd

X.description: Configuration and stats for the X player (always moves first)

O.description: Configuration and stats for the O player

board_size.description: Size of the game board (15x15 or 19x19). Defaults to 19 if not specified.

radius.description: Search radius around existing stones for AI move generation

timeout.description: Move timeout: 'none' for unlimited, or seconds as integer

winner.description: Winner of the game: 'X', 'O', 'draw', or 'none' if still in progress

board_state.description: Visual representation of the board as an array of strings. Each string represents a row with cells separated by spaces. Cells contain '.', 'X', 'O', or Unicode equivalents

moves.description: Chronological list of moves made in the game

name.description: Name identifier for tactical test scenarios

description.description: Human-readable description of the game or test scenario

difficulty.description: Difficulty level for tactical test scenarios

expected_moves.description: List of acceptable correct moves for tactical tests

explanation.description: Explanation of the expected move for tactical tests

player.description: Type of player controlling this side

depth.description: Search depth for AI players (required if player is 'AI')

time_ms.description: Total time spent by this player in milliseconds

coordinate.description: Board coordinate as [row, column], 0-indexed from top-left

scoring_entry.description: Result from a single evaluator step during AI move selection

player.description: Whose perspective this evaluator checked: 'current' (AI to move) or 'opponent'

evaluated_moves.description: Number of candidate moves this evaluator examined

score.description: Best score found by this evaluator. Positive for current player advantage, negative for opponent threats

time_ms.description: Wall-clock time spent in this evaluator step (milliseconds)

decisive.description: True if this evaluator determined the final move choice

have_win.description: True if an immediate winning move was found

have_vct.description: True if a Victory by Continuous Threats sequence was found

vct_sequence.description: Sequence of forcing moves in the VCT (only present when have_vct is true)

move.description: A single move in the game. Contains exactly one move key identifying the player and move coordinates

X (human).description: Move coordinates for human X player

X (AI).description: Move coordinates for AI X player

O (human).description: Move coordinates for human O player

O (AI).description: Move coordinates for AI O player

time_ms.description: Time taken for this move in milliseconds

moves_evaluated.description: Number of positions evaluated by AI for this move

moves_searched.description: Deprecated: use moves_evaluated. Kept for backwards compatibility

score.description: Threat score created by this move for the moving player

opponent.description: Threat score the opponent would have gained by playing here

winner.description: True if this move wins the game

queue_wait_ms.description: Time spent waiting in the server queue before processing (milliseconds). Passed through from client request.

offensive_max_score.description: Best offensive score found across all evaluators (only on last AI move, when --report-scoring is enabled)

defensive_max_score.description: Best opponent threat score found (negative value; only on last AI move, when --report-scoring is enabled)

think_time_ms.description: Total AI thinking time for this move in milliseconds (only on last AI move, when --report-scoring is enabled)

scoring.description: Detailed scoring report showing each evaluator step the AI ran to decide this move (only on last AI move, when --report-scoring is enabled)
